greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: n!/pp, where pp is the largest perfect power (A001597) which divides n!.
link: Robert G. Wilson v, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
formula: If p is prime, then a(p) = p*a(p-1).
mathematica: perfectPowerQ[n_] := n == 1 || GCD @@ FactorInteger[n][[All, 2]] > 1; f[n_] := Block[{d = Divisors[n!], k = 1},  While[ ! perfectPowerQ[ d[[-k]]], k++]; n!/d[[-k]]]; Array[f, 41, 0] (* or *)
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 07 2014
